gb.deck: A ninja-themed video game based on the 1994 movie of the same name. Three ninja brothers must retrieve a stolen dagger.

gb.deck: A nuclear submarine themed simulation game released by Electronic Arts.
An unlicensed gambling sim for the Genesis.

Based on the '90s Nickelodeon cartoon of the same name, players control a trio of young monsters-in-training as they venture out to the human world to evaluate their ability to terrify the population.
Aa Harimanada is a sumo wrestling game based on the anime of the same name and released only in Japan.

A compilation of 52 bite-sized games, each shittier than the last, Action 52 is now infamous for being plagued with programming bugs. A contest which involved one of its included games was rendered meaningless because of such a glitch. Much of the sound track is plagerized.
A 2D platformer loosely based on the film of the same name. The player controls Gomez Addams as he attempts to save his family from their no-good lawyer Tully Alford.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Game Boy, Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Nintendo Entertainment System

gb.deck: A turn-based strategy game set in WW2 that was developed by Sega for the Mega Drive with license from the original Daisenryaku developers SystemSoft.

gb.aliases: The Adventures of Batman and Robin
gb.deck: A set of three separate games that share the same title and are all based on the Batman animated TV series. The SNES version is more of an action platformer, while the Genesis and Game Gear versions are more of a shooter and the Sega CD version consists of only Batmobile levels.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega CD

gb.deck: A horizontal-scrolling Arcade shoot 'em up developed by Kaneko. It saw home conversions for the TurboGrafx-16 and Genesis (on the Genesis it is known as Air Buster).

Aero The Acro-Bat: Rascal Rival Revenge
Acrobat Kid

gb.deck: A Super Nintendo sequel featuring SunSoft's daredevil rodent in another high-flying adventure.

gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sharp X68000

gb.deck: A turn-based management simulation game in which the player owns an airline business. It is the sequel to Aerobiz, and features near-future scenarios involving supersonic flight.

A Z-axis shoot 'em up from Sega that features a F-14 Tomcat jet fighter and incredible speeds. Like the racing game OutRun, After Burner II would become a huge success for Sega in the Arcades. The game was later released to different consoles.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Atari ST, Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega 32X, Saturn, TurboGrafx-16, Arcade, PC, FM Towns, Nintendo 3DS eShop

gb.deck: Air Diver is an action flight sim exclusively for the Genesis.

igdb.name: Alex Kidd In The Enchanted Castle

gb.deck: An action/platformer game for the Sega Genesis that marked Alex Kidd's first (and only) 16-bit outing. Alex Kidd is out to find his missing father, King Thor, somewhere on Planet Paperock.

name: Alex Kidd In The Enchanted Castle

gb.deck: An action game from Acclaim based on the 1992 David Fincher movie. The player assumes the role of Ripley as she explores the prison planet of Fury 161.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Game Boy, Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System

gb.deck: Players fight boss after boss in this side-scroller from Treasure.
Alien Storm is an arcade beat-em-up by Sega in the same vein as the more successful Golden Axe. The game was ported to a number of different home systems, most notably the Sega Genesis.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Sega Master System, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Xbox 360, Arcade, Wii Shop, PC

gb.deck: The mage-warrior Alisia must save the world from an evil space-borne terror with the help of her magical pets.
A competitive multiplayer action game based on the TV game show American Gladiators. Players compete against the clock and each other to complete events and obstacle courses.

gb.deck: This is the first tennis game to use Andre Agassi's likeness. It came out for many Sega and Nintendo platforms.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System

gb.deck: A licensed platformer game released for both the SNES and the Genesis systems. Both games, although fairly different, allows the player to switch between the Warner Brothers (and Warner Sister) at will in order to overcome obstacles.

A side scrolling shooter in space, for the Genesis, which features a spaceship that can transform into a mecha.
An art creation program developed for the Sega Genesis, it features tools to create animations and static images and includes stamps for a few famous Sega characters.

SNK's second foray into the fighting game genre, known for its dedicated linear story, camera zooming effect (allowing for large character sprites in close-range combat), and the introduction of a gauge that depletes when certain moves are used.

gb.deck: A turn-based strategy war game only released in Japan.

Ball Jacks is a game where you need 2 players when one player controls a vertical-moving robot crab and player two controls a horizontal robot crab. The goal of the game is to use your crab's claws to capture your opponent's balls while defending your own.
Unlicensed dual game cartridge for Genesis, released in the US and Taiwan.

Ballz: The Director's Cut
3 Jigen Kakuto: Ballz
Ballz 3D: The Battle of the Ballz
Balls 3D
gb.deck: A unique fighting game that gives the illusion of 3D by having all fighters composed of nothing but pre-rendered balls of various colors and sizes.

gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, PC

gb.deck: A 2D side-scrolling mini-game compendium with a Barbie theme. Barbie travels across the US to go SCUBA diving in Florida, visit the County Fair in Iowa, try horse riding in Texas, go camping in Wyoming and relax at home in California.

gb.aliases:
Barkley no Power Dunk
Barkley's Power Dunk
gb.deck: A basketball game that stars former NBA all-star Charles Barkley as he jams and slams in the downtown basketball courts of different NBA cities.
As the famous children's PBS icon, guide Barney through the levels as he searches for children playing hide and seek, as well as special collectible objects.

Battletech 3050
gb.deck: The second SNES game in the MechWarrior franchise, also released for the Genesis as Battletech. It traded the series' trademark cockpit view for an isometric perspective and more emphasis on shooting than simulation.

A genre-defying tale of two toads' quest to rescue their kidnapped friends from the clenches of the Dark Queen. Where Frogger brought frogs to the forefront of videogaming, Battletoads taught children that toads weren't frogs and were here to kick some ass.

gb.deck: An unusual wrestling game for the Genesis, featuring grotesque monsters and robots on an isometric plane. Though its presentation is extremely different, it has a fairly similar gameplay foundation to pro wrestling games of the era.
A Sega Genesis adaptation of Disney's animated 1991 film Beauty and the Beast.

Side scrolling two player shoot-em-up for the Sega Genesis notable for its eerie biological enemies and organic environments.
A side-scrolling beat 'em up based on the anime and manga Sailor Moon. Released for the SNES and Genesis.
A side-scrolling action-platformer for the Genesis, playable as either a huntress, a warrior, or a sorcerer. Each character has different combat abilities.
This sequel to Blaster Master was built and sold without the consent of the original game's developers.

Compete as some of the greatest legends in boxing history in this 16-bit boxing game.

A horror action platformer game based on the movie of the same name, released on a multitude of platforms from 1993 on, developed by Psygnosis, Traveller's Tales, and Probe Entertainment and published by Sony Imagesoft and Psygnosis.

A martial arts game created by Electronic Arts that includes unarmed karate and a few weapon-based arts.

Some USAF pilots are forced to run-and-gun their way to freedom in this Vietnam War-themed top-down shooter from SETA.

California Games is a multiple event sports game released on multiple 8-bit and 16-bit computers, consoles and handhelds. Developed by 80s legends Epyx, with a reputation for producing multiple-event games, traditional sports were abandoned to accommodate less-established pursuits associated with The Golden State.

Chakan was such a powerful swordsman that even Death could not defeat him in battle. However, centuries later, he has become tired of life and will do anything to finally be able to die.
A sprawling platformer for the the Genesis/Mega Drive notable for power-ups that change the player character's abilities and appearance.

Combat Cars is a top-down racing game, released for the Genesis in 1994. As the game's title suggests, its gameplay consists of a little bit more than just racing--players also must destroy their opponents with a variety of weaponry.

All was swell for the comic book artist and part-time rock musician Sketch Turner until his apartment got struck by lightning and he gets sucked into his own comic, where he has to fight off mutants and other monstrosities to save himself, as well as "the girl".

gb.deck: Command & Conquer is the first entry in the long running series of real-time strategy games.

Red Zone is a top down shooter where you take control of an AH-64B Apache attack helicopter. A mad Dictator is planning to nuke the world. It's up to an elite chopper team to stop him before he succeeds. Similar to Desert Strike you pick up fuel and ammo.
With the end of the Alien Wars comes a new squad of elite commandos bringing order to a chaotic world: the Hard Corps.
Explore the world as Spot, the tiny mascot of the 7 Up brand of soft drinks, and rescue its fellow Spots in this 2D platformer.

name: Crayon Shin-chan: Arashi O Yobu - Neandororon Daihenshi

gb.deck: Multi-part vertical shooter that sees the player run 'n' gun on the ground and taking to the skies in a helicopter.

A pinball game that came out at the height of Mötley Crüe's career, when their album  Dr. Feelgood was at the top of the charts.  Instrumentals of the songs "Dr. Feelgood", "Live Wire", and "Home Sweet Home" were the only tunes featured in this game.
Battle enemies with the help of animal pals in this Zelda-inspired action-adventure for the Genesis. One of the few games to portray enemies more sympathetically, rather than mindless evil drones.
An action-adventure game that has players go on an adventure to save their pony friends.
A sideways scrolling shoot 'em up Sega Mega Drive game released in 1989 and developed by Micronet. Curse was never officially released outside of Japan.
An action platformer based on the 1995 movie. Female pirate captain Morgan Adams attempts to beat her villainous uncle Dawg to the treasure of Cutthroat Island.
gb.platforms: Game Boy, Game Gear, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System

gb.deck: Cyborg Justice is a scrolling beat 'em up for the Sega Genesis. You play as a robot you design yourself as you battle it out against a horde of similar enemies.

igdb.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Warriors of the Eternal Sun

gb.deck: Set in the world of Dungeons and Dragons, Warriors of the Eternal Sun is an adventure RPG using a party system.  Set in an unknown world populated with enemies, the heroes have to begin an epic quest for the sake of kingdom and culture.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Warriors of the Eternal Sun

gb.deck: A side-scrolling brawler released in 1989 by Kaneko for the Arcade and, later, Genesis.  The game features a uniquely Japanese take on mid-to-late 80s hip-hop/urban culture. DJ Boy is a rollerskater hoping to win the "Rollergame" fight-race competition in Cigaretch city.

gb.deck: The warrior maiden Dahna chases after the evil sorceress who attacked her adoptive village in this grisly side-scrolling action game.
Vertically scrolling shooter from Namco. Take on hordes of biomechanical insectoid enemies in a spaceship that steadily gains extra parts.
In the first installment of the Dark Castle series, Prince Duncan must test his stamina and dexterity against the traps and henchmen of the Black Knight in order to escape the fortress.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Mac, CD-i, Apple IIgs, PC

gb.deck: Race to get the girl of your dreams.
One of the first tennis simulations using foreground and background to simulate the z-axis.
David Robinson's Supreme Court is a basketball game for the Genesis and was developed by Sega. The game featured fictional teams.
A Christmas-themed platformer developed by Funcom and published by Sunsoft. It was originally released for the Sega Genesis, but was later ported to the Super Nintendo.
Also known as "Power Moves", Deadly Moves is a 2D fighter where a martial artist (simply named Joe) must train worldwide with seven unique martial arts masters to become the best fighter.
An ultra-gory strategic shooter played in first-person viewpoint from RazorSoft.

igdb.name: Desert Strike: Return to the Gulf

gb.deck: A top-down isometric helicopter shoot 'em up originally for the Sega Genesis, which was later ported to a variety of platforms. It is best known for its open-ended mission design and was followed by several sequels.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Game Boy, Game Boy Advance, Game Gear, Genesis, Atari Lynx, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, PC

name: Desert Strike: Return to the Gulf

gb.deck: An occult/horror themed Arkanoid clone for Sega Genesis. Plus, it's like, totally Satanic.
A side scrolling shooter developed by Sega for the Genesis and Master System. In it, hard-hitting police detective Dick Tracy must track down a suspicious nitroglycerin shipment.
Dick Vitale's "Awesome, Baby!" College Hoops is an arcade-like college basketball game released for the genesis.
A fast playing soccer game by Dino Dini, published by Virgin in 1994.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Atari ST, PC

gb.deck: Dino Land is a dinosaur themed pinball game for the Sega Genesis.
Dinosaurs band together to appreciate firearms.

igdb.name: Disney Collection - Castle of Illusion & Quackshot

gb.deck: Castle of Illusion and Quackshot on a single cartridge! Only released in Europe.

name: Disney Collection - Castle of Illusion & Quackshot

gb.deck: Disney's Aladdin was the title of several different games from different developers based on the classic Disney film, Aladdin. As the titular character, players venture through many levels inspired by events and locations in the movie.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Game Boy, Game Boy Advance, Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Nintendo Entertainment System, Game Boy Color, PC

gb.deck: Unlicensed Mega Drive Shooter wherein you shoot aliens and see naked anime ladies.

igdb.name: Ikasuze! Koi no Doki Doki Penguin Land MD

gb.deck: Ikazuse! Koi no Doki Doki Penguin Land MD is the third title in the Penguin Land series. It was only available on the Mega Drive's "Game Toshokan" download service.

name: Ikasuze! Koi no Doki Doki Penguin Land MD

Donald in Maui Mallard
Disney's Donald in Maui Mallard
gb.deck: Maui Mallard is out to collect him some Luau Loot in this mid-90s platformer.
gb.platforms: Game Boy, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, PC

gb.deck: A bloody run-and-gun platformer based on the eponymous collectible card game.

igdb.name: Doraemon: Yume Dorobou to 7 Nin no Gozans

name: Doraemon: Yume Dorobou to 7 Nin no Gozans

gb.deck: A top-down Micro Machines clone developed by ASCII Entertainment for the Genesis/Mega Drive. Released in Europe, 1993.
A game credited, in part, with the popularity of the brawler genre in the arcade craze of the 1980s and 1990s.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Game Boy, Game Gear, Genesis, Atari Lynx, Sega Master System, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, MSX, ZX Spectrum, Nintendo Entertainment System, Atari 2600, Atari 7800, Arcade, Xbox 360 Games Store, Wii Shop, PC, iPhone, Zeebo, Android, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch

Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-Kun: Bangai Rantouhen
Double Dragon 2
gb.deck: The Game Boy version of Double Dragon II is completely different from its console equivalents. Instead of an arcade port, this game is a conversion of a Japanese brawler.

gb.aliases:
Double Dragon 3: The Arcade Game
Double Dragon III: The Rosetta Stone
gb.deck: Billy, Jimmy, and the whole Double Dragon gang fight for the Sacred Stones to save in the world in yet another beat-em-up.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Game Boy, Genesis, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Nintendo Entertainment System, Arcade, PC, Wii U

igdb.name: Double Dragon V: The Shadow Falls

gb.deck: The sole video game adaptation of the cartoon spin-off of the Double Dragon game series. Rather than base itself on the original series' beat-'em-up roots, this game capitalizes on the popularity of the 2D fighting game genre.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Jaguar

name: Double Dragon V: The Shadow Falls

gb.aliases:
Hyper Dunk: The Playoff Edition
HyperDunk

gb.deck: Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine is a Sonic the Hedgehog-based reskin of competitive puzzle title Puyo Puyo. Players battle the mad doctor and twelve of his underlings in order to save the denizens of Beanville.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Wii Shop, PC, Nintendo 3DS

gb.deck: A fighter game based on Rob Cohen's motion picture depicting a semi-fictional retelling of Bruce Lee's life.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Jaguar

gb.aliases:
Buyuu Retsuden
Dragon Ball Z: L'Appel Du Destin
gb.deck: The sole Dragon Ball game released on a Sega platform, Buyuu Retsuden brings the high-flying combat from the Super Butoden series to the Mega Drive.

igdb.name: Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes

gb.deck: A turn-based fantasy RPG from Falcom released for home computers and ported to various consoles, including the TurboGrafx-CD. It is the first game in The Legend of Heroes series as well as the sixth in the Dragon Slayer series.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, MSX, TurboGrafx-CD, PC, NEC PC-8801, NEC PC-9801, FM-7

name: Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes

gb.deck: A turn-based fantasy RPG and the sequel to Nihon Falcom's Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes. The story of the original game continues a few years later with the previous game's hero's son, Prince Atlas.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, TurboGrafx-CD, PC, FM Towns, NEC PC-8801, NEC PC-9801

name: Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes II

Shanghai 2: Dragon's Eye
Super Shanghai: Dragon's Eye
 Dragon's Eye Plus: Shanghai 3
gb.deck: A Mahjong Solitaire game released on multiple platforms. It is the sequel to Shanghai, which was also published for many consoles and home computers.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, MSX, Wii Shop, PC

gb.deck: A fantasy-themed pinball game.
The completely overhauled Mega Drive version of Dune, including new graphics, new features, new levels, technology tree changes and streamlined controls.
Dyna Brothers is a 1992 strategy game for the Sega Mega Drive released exclusively in Japan. It was followed by Dyna Brothers 2.
Dyna Brothers 2 is an RTS game on Genesis, published by CRI in Japan in 1993.
A Sega-published arcade and Genesis over-the-shoulder rail shooting game, pitting the cybernetic Duke against an army of mutant, criminal baddies.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Sega Master System, Arcade, Sharp X68000

gb.deck: Play as Headdy to save the toys of North Town from the clutches of King Dark Demon in this 2D platformer.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Wii Shop, PC, iPhone, iPad, Android

gb.deck: Two classic sports titles on a single cartridge.
Ecco: The Tides of Time is the following game in the Ecco the Dolphin series.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Sega CD, Wii Shop, PC

gb.deck: Dive into the ocean with Ecco Jr.
Take control of a dolphin and solve the mystery of a powerful storm in this unconventional and notoriously-difficult 2D side-scroller published by Sega.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Sega CD, Xbox 360 Games Store, Wii Shop, PC, iPhone, Nintendo 3DS eShop

gb.deck: A baseball game that was released for the Sega Genesis, Sega CD, Super Nintendo and PC. It featured the MLB license but not the Player's Association license, so the team names are present but not the player names.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega CD, PC

gb.deck: A hockey game released in 1994 licensed by both the NHL and ESPN. Very similar to the EA Sports hockey games of the era.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega CD

gb.deck: A 16-bit racing game based on the ESPN TV show of the same name. It resembles NASCAR but doesn't mention it by name due to licensing issues.
A football game licensed by the Entertainment and Sports Programming Network and named for their 1987-2005 weekly TV series.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega CD

gb.deck: A side-scrolling platformer set in the near future, where the player controls a police officer who over a series of levels turns into the cyborg ESWAT.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Sega Master System, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Arcade, PC, iPhone, iPad, Android

gb.deck: In the 1930s, famous archeologist Earnest Evans sought out three powerful idols across the world to ensure they would not be combined and cause a massive calamity. However, he failed to find them. Fifty years later, his grandson must finish what his ancestor started.
The even more unhinged sequel to the original Earthworm Jim, which was known for its surreal graphical style and frantic run-and-gun gameplay.
gb.platforms: Game Boy Advance, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Mac, PlayStation, Saturn, Wii Shop, PC

gb.deck: An action platformer for the Megadrive/Genesis featuring a female lead and Lovecraftian deities. It was released in Japan in 1991.
The powerful sorcerer Laden is forced to fight his brother Roki, who has now become Gyra: Lord of Darkness, in this vertically-scrolling fantasy shoot 'em up.
Eliminate Down is a horizontal shooter for the Sega Genesis that allows a ship to take on three shooting styles: forward, backward, and vertical.
Help TAZ escape from the zoo on Mars.
gb.platforms: Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System

gb.aliases:
XZR II
XZR 2
Exile: Toki no Hazama e
gb.deck: Exile, also known as XZR II, is the side scrolling, action RPG sequel to XZR. It was first released for Japanese computers in 1988. Both North American releases, especially the Genesis one, were censored due to the heavy religious, adult and drug-related themes.
gb.platforms: Genesis, MSX, TurboGrafx-CD, NEC PC-8801, NEC PC-9801

igdb.name: Exodus: Journey to the Promised Land

gb.deck: Exodus: Journey to the Promised Land is an unlicensed game developed by Color Dreams, Inc. and published by Wisdom Tree, Inc. in 1991 for the Nintendo Entertainment System.
gb.platforms: Game Boy, Genesis, Nintendo Entertainment System, PC

name: Exodus: Journey to the Promised Land

gb.deck: F-117 Night Storm is an arcade flight simulator where you take control of an F-117A Stealth Fighter.
F-15 Strike Eagle II is a 1991 flight simulator from MicroProse.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Atari ST, PC, Sharp X68000

gb.deck: A combat flight sim for the Sega Genesis that featured as its chosen aircraft what would become the F-22 Raptor.
The sole Mega Drive entry in Nichibutsu's Formula One racing series.

igdb.name: Nakajima Satoru Kanshuu: F1 Grand Prix

gb.deck: A licensed Formula One game from Varie endorsed by professional racer Satoru Nakajima. It is the predecessor to Ferrari Grand Prix Challenge.

name: Nakajima Satoru Kanshuu: F1 Grand Prix

name: Nakajima Satoru Kanshuu: F1 Super License

gb.deck: Formula 1 racing with real teams and drivers from the '94 season.
gb.platforms: Amiga, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System

gb.deck: FIFA 95 is the second installment of the popular FIFA franchise. This version included many more teams than the first FIFA, and this time there were clubs involved.
FIFA 98: Road to World Cup is a multiplatform instalment of the popular soccer video game series, allowing players to relive moments from the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
gb.platforms: Game Boy, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, PlayStation, Saturn, Nintendo 64, PC

gb.deck: An Amiga RPG that had impressive graphics for its time. It also boasts a massive game world of over 17,000 screens, though only a handful contain anything noteworthy.
An adaptation of the TV quiz show where two families compete for cash prizes. These versions were all published by GameTek and developed by various developers between 1991 and 1994.
gb.platforms: Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Nintendo Entertainment System, 3DO
